titlestmt.titleproper: Wagner Free Institute of Science director's files regarding building improvements 1885-1913
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012

did.unittitle: Wagner Free Institute of Science director's files regarding building improvements

bioghist.p: Incorporated by William Wagner in 1855, the Wagner Free Institute is a natural history museum and educational institution in Philadelphia that is dedicated to providing free public education in the sciences. In 1892, the Free Library of Philadelphia opened its first branch at the Institute. It was determined that more space was needed to house the library branch, and in 1901, a new wing of the Institute building was opened for that purpose. In 1962 the branch was moved from the Wagner to Cecil B. Moore Avenue.

scopecontent.p: This collection consists of correspondence, bills, plans, and receipts from builders and the architects, Collins and Autenrieth and the Hewitt brothers, concerning various renovation projects including the improvement of the grounds and the 1901 addition to house the Wagner Branch of the Free Library of Philadelphia.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

otherfindaid.p: An inventory is available in the repository.

relatedmaterial.p: Related material may be found in the following collections: Wagner Free Institute of Science: other collections that include significant amounts of director's records include: director's files and business records (90-010), Actuary and Librarian records (91-040), director's reports (98-045 and 00-01), and other director's files (90-001 and 89-055, 91-030, 93-005, 99-109, and 00-02).
